law.full_text:
REMOVAL OF BENCHES. (Amended by Ord. No. 112,719, Eff. 2/28/59.)
(a) After the revocation of the permit, the Board may remove and store the bench installed or maintained under such permit, if the permittee fails to do so within 10 days after notice.
(b) (Amended by Ord. No. 161,889, Eff. 2/16/87.) The permittee may recover the bench, if within 60 days after its removal, he pays the cost of such removal and storage, which shall be the actual cost for removal, and $6.00 per month for storage, for each such bench. After 60 days from its removal, the Board may sell, destroy or otherwise dispose of the bench at its discretion. All of the foregoing shall be at the sole risk of the permittee, and shall be in addition to any other remedy provided by law for the violation of this section.

unit.catch_line: Permit Required From Board Of Public Works.
Bond Or Insurance Policy – Limit Of Liability.

law.plain_text:
LOS ANGELES MUNICIPAL CODE
REMOVAL OF BENCHES. (§ 68.07)
REMOVAL OF BENCHES. (Amended by Ord. No. 112,719, Eff. 2/28/59.) (a) After the revocation of the permit, the Board may remove and store the bench installed or maintained under such permit, if the permittee fails to do so within 10 days after notice. (b) (Amended by Ord. No. 161,889, Eff. 2/16/87.) The permittee may recover the bench, if within 60 days after its removal, he pays the cost of such removal and storage, which shall be the actual cost for removal, and $6.00 per month for storage, for each such bench. After 60 days from its removal, the Board may sell, destroy or otherwise dispose of the bench at its discretion. All of the foregoing shall be at the sole risk of the permittee, and shall be in addition to any other remedy provided by law for the violation of this section.
